required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Targeted Resection of Axillary Metastatic Lymph Nodes After Breast Cancer Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Targeted Resection of Axillary Metastatic Lymph Nodes Guided by Tissue Marker Clip After Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy for Breast Cancer: a Multicenter, Prospective and Self-controlled Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a multi-center, prospective, self-controlled study, to evaluate the feasibility of targeted axillary lymph node resection (TAD) guided by tissue marker clip with methylene blue single tracer after neoadjuvant chemotherapy in T1-4N1M0 breast cancer patients. Evaluate the accuracy and false negative rate of TAD, comparing with sentinel lymph node biopsy, and explore a new axillary-preserving mode after neoadjuvant chemotherapy for breast cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: False negative rate (FNR) of targeted axillary lymph node resection
primary_outcome.description: False negative rate (FNR) of targeted axillary lymph node resection of breast cancer with methylene blue single tracer after neoadjuvant chemotherapy for T1-3N1M0 breast cancer

intervention.description: Tissue Marker Clip Placed in Metastatic Lymph Node (Before Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy for Breast Cancer)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. breast cancer with axillary lymph node metastasis confirmed by puncture pathology (T1-3N1M0)
2. accord with the indications of neoadjuvant chemotherapy for breast cancer
3. informed consent has been signed
4. Preoperative anesthesia assessment is low to medium risk (ASA score)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. There are absolute and relative contraindications of chemotherapy
2. Refuse surgery or can't tolerate surgery
3. Unable to cooperate or unwilling to place Marker
4. Pregnant women
5. Do not have full capacity for behavior, such as mental patients, drug dependence, anxiety and so on
6. Diabetes patients who are difficult to control
7. Excessive smokers
8. high risk of anesthesia
9. Any serious complications are not suitable for patients participating in this study

facility.name: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University, China

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan
